@zone1511 Can you provide some scenario about why should access the `active span stack`? I think this is your asking, right?
IMO, the active span is the only right span and object, which you should manipulate in the plugin or interceptor. Because you can't make sure which spans are in the `active stack` now.

First of all, I don't recommend to provide plugin comments, unless it is really necessary or it is only a primary plugin(it it up to you, then). Because, SkyWalking provides auto instrument mechanism. More configurations mean less auto, right.

Still, in tech way, we provide a plugin section in [**plugin config class**](https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/apm-sniffer/apm-agent-core/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/agent/core/conf/Config.java#L138). All the config will be set automatically, when you add a new property in [agent config file](https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/apm-sniffer/config/agent.config) with the same lower case name in Config object.

Just image a case if I only want to trace sql performance for certain url only, the jdbc plugin has to check if in the stack there is a span which is a web url type span and check if the url is match or not. 
Since the active span only tells you the current span, if you want to trace the whole call stack, there is no option right now unless the contextmanager provides function to expose the `active stack`

using single shared config class will make the configuration item couple with the shared config class. Configurable may not be a bad thing if there is a working default. It is use to fine tune the plugin if required.

I understand your scenario now. Here is my suggestion:

The real thing you want is a `RuntimeTracingContext` inside the TracingContext, which I proposal to implement in a commercial product, but didn't add it to SkyWalking agent module yet.
* **RuntimeTracingContext** will not be serialized to collector, just to propagate the context in the thread.
* By using that, you can add the service url into it, then you can access the url from anywhere inside the context.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/14877033/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/14877033)

Coverage decreased (-0.01%) to 22.185% when pulling **f3847972e35719a8090b7c7b20e68e5247212c8c on goldonship:patch-1** into **e5ea6cf33154f4319a82029038ca533e4e593384 on apache:master**.

With more plugins, I think I can provide a config item register mechanism, which allow each plugin to register a config class to the **ConfigInitializer**.

Which plugin do you intend to provide if I added this config mechanism?
@goldonship Merged.
@zone1511 We haven't implemented or intend to implement any feature, which need the `RuntimeTracingContext`. Do you want to extend SkyWalking analysis features?

As related to another thread, I would like to build a conditional sql logging plugin which only log if the sql is execute by certain servlet/mvc action. In this case, I need a config file to store which url(s) should be handle/skip
yes, im interest to extend skywalking to add more analytic functions.

All recent jdbc-related plugins trace sql without any parameter value. If you want to develop private plugin, you can implement your own Config mechanism. 

The project core only provides and maintains the community features (ASF requirements).  So unless we are going to do some open source plugins/features together, this feature will stay in `could be added` rather than `should be added`.
The official core don't find any real scenario, which need this access way. Your requirements look like a custom way, maybe in order to improve performance( cost less network brand ).

As I mentioned here : https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/issues/721#issuecomment-355174368

> The project core only provides and maintains the community features (ASF requirements). So unless we are going to do some open source plugins/features together, this feature will stay in could be added rather than should be added.

> Why not use the concept of "EntryNode" just like "EntrySpan"

`EntryNode` is hard to explain for APM end user. Because for an application node, there always have Entry and Exit Spans. But for a monitored system(cluster), there are just incoming and conjecture nodes. If we use EntryNode, conjecture nodes have to be named as ExitNode.
Can I make a pull request for this requirement so that plugins has ability to access the span stack?
You can try. But I doubt whether you can get enough committor or PMC member support. Because they will ask for real use case for SkyWalking itselft, rather than your custom requirements.

Hi @xjr100419 , You can see how we ignore the url by suffix, so there are 2 options:
1. Using the current mechanism, put the whole URLs(e.g. hear beat url) in the `agent.ignore_suffix`. The ignore works, I suppose.
1. Alter the agent codes in your fork, like the current mechanism did. Then recompile the 3.2.6 to provide this feature.

It is up to you.

@lytscu Since the AsyncHttpClient plugin almost finished, please focus on building the integration with ServiceComb (Huawei open source project, accepted by Apache, too)

I will help you to make the contact with their team leader, @WillemJiang . We can work on this together.

@xjr100419 @18474475 I am aware of your requirements. But the core team has no time on this in this two months. So if any of you is interested, I am happy to work with you on a pull request.

New protocol has been provided:
1. Add set/get `DataTTLConfigs` and set/get `AlarmThreshold` service.
1. All empty arrays are represented by `[]`, not `null`.
1. Add Mutation type, represents for all modification operations.
1. Support **Pagination** in some query.
1. Seperate alarm into to title and content

@peng-yongsheng @hanahmily

@myoss We have not located the issue. No more similar reports from community, and  more resources have been deployed into 5.0 UI. So sorry, we can't support you in a short time.
I am closing this. The UI features are developing, and most are finished. Look forward @hanahmily to share us the exited 5.0 UI.
I spend a week to provide the first instrument in #730 .

@chanwu79 Based on our integration tests, we are going to make sure most version are supported. You can see the status from here: https://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report#postgresql .
Based on [test reports](https://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report#httpclient), http client 4.4 , 4.5 have been supported.
Closing this. Already supported.
Alarm features will be provided in 5.0 . Multi-tenant is not an expected feature in our milestone.
Alarm features will be provided in 5.0 . Multi-tenant is not an expected feature in our milestone.
Designed and provided in 5.0. Check [UI-Query-Protocol](https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/apm-protocol/apm-ui-protocol/src/main/resources/ui-graphql/README.md)
Alerting based on response time and success rate will be provided in 5.0 . Almost codes are done.
Ok ,I will make contact with Teacher Jiang.

First of all, CI passed, means the compile status is health. Then we didn't expect you to compile a single module of the project. See https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/How-to-build.md to know how to compile.

And then, 5.0 is our next release, and branch `master` is for development. So I didn't recommend you to use it, else you want to contribute somethings.

We haven't release version after we accepted by Apache. So 3.x is not an Apache release.
I think the `NativeWebRequest` object should be remove too,
